msContents.summary: Psalms 26-27; 38-41: bifolium: 2a Psalm 38: 8-13; 2a-2b, 3a Psalm 39; 3a-3b Psalm 40; 3b Psalm 41:1; leaf: 1a Psalm 26: 7-14; 1a-1b Psalm 27. When originally written Psalms 39, 40, 27 were complete; presently there are lacunae

msItemStruct.note: Bifolium and a single leaf from a codex
The bifolium is also a palimpsest, the primary text being perpendicular to the secondary text (Psalms)
The single leaf, which precedes the bifolium has page numbers in the upper right/left hand corner
Fol. 1a 26 lines; fol. 1b 29 lines; fol. 2a 22 lines; fol. 2b 30 lines; fol. 3a 28 lines; fol. 3b 27 lines; fol. 1 broken at bottom and right; bifolium complete

The text is divided into sections: each section is marked with a psalm number, a traditional heading in red ink and a decorative border of brown and red ink; the initial letter of each section is enlarged and decorated with red ink

supportDesc.support: 2 parchment fragments; fol. 1. 20.1 x 13 cm.; bifolium 22.7 x 14.5 cm

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.
